Meaning: a good thing that seemed bad at first
Avoid saying what you mean, usually because it is uncomfortable
Better to arrive late than not to come at all
To get something over with because it is inevitable
Doing something poorly in order to save time or money

Idiom: Get something out of your system
Meaning: Do the thing you've been wanting to do so you can move on
Transliteration: Get something out of your system

Translated: अपने कार्य को एक साथ रखें

Idiom: Give someone the benefit of the doubt
Transliteration: Give someone the benefit of the doubt
Translated: किसी को संदेह का लाभ देना

Idiom: Go back to the drawing board
Transliteration: Go back to the drawing board

Meaning: To not hold someone responsible for something
Translated: किसी को गड्ढे से बाहर निकालें

Meaning: You have to work for what you want
Translated: कोई दर्द नहीं, कोई लाभ नहीं

Meaning: Things are going well so far
The person we were just talking about showed up!

Idiom: Time flies when you're having fun
Meaning: You don't notice how long something lasts when it's fun
Transliteration: Time flies when you're having fun
Translated: समय उड़ता है जब आप मज़े कर रहे हैं

Idiom: To get bent out of shape
Transliteration: To get bent out of shape
Translated: आकार से बाहर निकलने के लिए
चीजों को बदतर बनाने के लिए

Idiom: We'll cross that bridge when we come to it
Meaning: Let's not talk about that problem right now
Transliteration: We'll cross that bridge when we come to it
Translated: हम उस पुल को पार करेंगे जब हम उस तक पहुंच जाएंगे
अपने सिर को कुछ के चारों ओर घुमाएं
आप फिर से कह सकते हैं

Idiom: Your guess is as good as mine
Transliteration: Your guess is as good as mine
Translated: आपका अनुमान मेरे जैसा अच्छा है

Idiom: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
Meaning: What you have is worth more than what you might have later
Transliteration: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
Translated: हाथ में एक पक्षी बश में दो के लायक है
आपके विचारों के लिए एक पेन

Idiom: A penny saved is a penny earned
Meaning: Money you save today you can spend later
Transliteration: A penny saved is a penny earned
Translated: एक पेन बचाया है एक पेन कमाया है
एक तस्वीर 1000 शब्दों के लायक है

Meaning: Believe what people do and not what they say
Translated: कार्य शब्दों की तुलना में अधिक जोर से बोलते हैं

Meaning: To make a bad situation worse
To be mistaken, to be looking for solutions in the wrong place

Idiom: Birds of a feather flock together
Meaning: People who are alike are often friends (usually used negatively)
Transliteration: Birds of a feather flock together
Translated: एक पंख के पक्षी एक साथ घूमते हैं

Idiom: Bite off more than you can chew
Meaning: Take on a project that you cannot finish
Transliteration: Bite off more than you can chew
Translated: आप जो कर सकते हैं उससे अधिक काटें

Idiom: By the skin of your teeth
Transliteration: By the skin of your teeth

Meaning: Comparing two things that cannot be compared
Translated: सेब और नारंगी की तुलना करें

Idiom: Costs an arm and a leg
Transliteration: Costs an arm and a leg
Translated: एक हाथ और एक पैर की कीमत

Idiom: Do something at the drop of a hat
Meaning: Do something without having planned beforehand
Transliteration: Do something at the drop of a hat
Translated: एक टोपी के झटके पर कुछ करें

Idiom: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you
Meaning: Treat people fairly. Also known as "The Golden Rule"
Transliteration: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you
Translated: दूसरों के साथ ऐसा ही करें जैसा आप चाहते हैं कि वे आपके साथ करें

Idiom: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
Meaning: Don't count on something good happening until it's happened.
Transliteration: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
Translated: अपने चिकनों को हिट करने से पहले गिनती न करें

Meaning: There's no reason to complain about something that can't be fixed
Translated: दूध के बारे में रोने की कोशिश न करें

Idiom: Don't give up your day job
Meaning: You're not very good at this
Transliteration: Don't give up your day job
Translated: अपने दिन के काम को न छोड़ें

Idiom: Don't put all your eggs in one basket
Meaning: What you're doing is too risky
Transliteration: Don't put all your eggs in one basket
Translated: अपने सभी अंडे को एक कटोरे में न डालें

Idiom: Every cloud has a silver lining
Meaning: Good things come after bad things
Transliteration: Every cloud has a silver lining
Translated: हर बादल में एक चांदी की छड़ी होती है।

Idiom: Get a taste of your own medicine
Meaning: Get treated the way you've been treating others (negative)
Transliteration: Get a taste of your own medicine

Idiom: Go on a wild goose chase
Transliteration: Go on a wild goose chase
Translated: एक जंगली गोजी शिकार पर जाओ

Idiom: Good things come to those who wait
Transliteration: Good things come to those who wait
Translated: अच्छी चीजें उन लोगों के लिए आती हैं जो इंतजार करते हैं

Idiom: He has bigger fish to fry
Meaning: He has bigger things to take care of than what we are talking about now
Transliteration: He has bigger fish to fry
Translated: मछली पकड़ने के लिए बड़ा है

Idiom: He's a chip off the old block
Meaning: The son is like the father
Transliteration: He's a chip off the old block
Translated: वह पुराने ब्लॉक से एक चिप है

Idiom: Hit the nail on the head
Transliteration: Hit the nail on the head
Translated: सिर पर नाखून को हिट करें

Idiom: It ain't over till the fat lady sings
Transliteration: It ain't over till the fat lady sings
Translated: यह तब तक नहीं चलेगा जब तक कि वसा महिला गाती है

Idiom: It takes one to know one
Meaning: You're just as bad as I am
Transliteration: It takes one to know one
Translated: एक को जानने की जरूरत है
यह बारिश है बिल्लियों और कुत्तों

Idiom: Kill two birds with one stone
Meaning: Get two things done with a single action
Transliteration: Kill two birds with one stone
Translated: एक पत्थर के साथ दो पक्षियों को मारो

Idiom: Let the cat out of the bag
Transliteration: Let the cat out of the bag
Translated: बिल्ली को बैग से बाहर निकालें

Meaning: On probation. If you make another mistake, there will be trouble.
To argue the opposite, just for the sake of argument

Translated: एक बारिश के दिन के लिए बचत

Idiom: Slow and steady wins the race
Meaning: Reliability is more important than speed
Transliteration: Slow and steady wins the race
Translated: धीरे-धीरे और स्थिर दौड़ जीतता है

Idiom: Take it with a grain of salt
Transliteration: Take it with a grain of salt
Translated: इसे एक नमक के अनाज के साथ लें

Idiom: The ball is in your court
Transliteration: The ball is in your court

Idiom: The best thing since sliced bread
Transliteration: The best thing since sliced bread
Translated: रोटी के बाद सबसे अच्छी चीज

Idiom: The devil is in the details
Meaning: It looks good from a distance, but when you look closer, there are problems
Transliteration: The devil is in the details

Idiom: The early bird gets the worm
Meaning: The first people who arrive will get the best stuff
Transliteration: The early bird gets the worm
Translated: शुरुआती पक्षी को चमगादड़ मिलती है

Meaning: The big issue, the problem people are avoiding

Idiom: There are other fish in the sea
Meaning: It's ok to miss this opportunity. Others will arise.
Transliteration: There are other fish in the sea

Idiom: There's a method to his madness
Meaning: He seems crazy but actually he's clever
Transliteration: There's a method to his madness
Translated: उसके पागलपन के लिए एक तरीका है

Idiom: There's no such thing as a free lunch
Transliteration: There's no such thing as a free lunch
Translated: एक मुफ्त दोपहर का भोजन के रूप में कुछ भी नहीं है

Idiom: You can't have your cake and eat it too
Transliteration: You can't have your cake and eat it too
Translated: आप अपने केक नहीं ले सकते और इसे भी खा सकते हैं

Idiom: You can't judge a book by its cover
Meaning: This person or thing may look bad, but it's good inside
Transliteration: You can't judge a book by its cover
Translated: आप एक किताब को उसके कवर से न्याय नहीं कर सकते

Idiom: A little learning is a dangerous thing
Meaning: People who don't understand something fully are dangerous
Transliteration: A little learning is a dangerous thing
Translated: थोड़ा सीखना एक खतरनाक बात है

Meaning: Events have momentum and build upon each other

Idiom: A stitch in time saves nine
Meaning: Fix the problem now because it will get worse later
Transliteration: A stitch in time saves nine
Translated: समय में एक स्टिक नौ बचाता है

Meaning: A big fuss about a small problem

Idiom: An apple a day keeps the doctor away
Transliteration: An apple a day keeps the doctor away
Translated: एक दिन में एक सेब डॉक्टर को दूर रखता है

Idiom: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure
Meaning: You can prevent a problem with little effort. Fixing it later is harder.
Transliteration: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure
Translated: एक औंस रोकथाम एक पाउंड उपचार के लायक है

Meaning: Something bad is coming, but right now it's calm

Translated: Curiosity ने बिल्ली को मार डाला

Meaning: Move on, this subject is over
Translated: एक मृत घोड़े को न मारो

Meaning: Everyone gets a chance at least once
Translated: हर कुत्ते का अपना दिन है

Meaning: The better you know someone the less you like him
Have more energy after having been tired
You'll make mistakes if you rush through something

Idiom: Have your head in the clouds
Transliteration: Have your head in the clouds
Translated: अपने सिर को बादलों में रखें

Idiom: He who laughs last laughs loudest
Meaning: I'll get you back for what you did
Transliteration: He who laughs last laughs loudest
Translated: जो हँसता है वह आखिरी हँसता है

Idiom: Hear something straight from the horse's mouth
Meaning: Hear something from the person involved
Transliteration: Hear something straight from the horse's mouth
Translated: घोड़े के मुंह से सीधे कुछ सुनो

Idiom: He's not playing with a full deck
Transliteration: He's not playing with a full deck
Translated: वह एक पूर्ण डेक के साथ नहीं खेलता है
वह अपने रॉकर से बाहर है

Meaning: He can't make up his mind

Idiom: It is a poor workman who blames his tools
Meaning: If you can't do the job, don't blame it on others
Transliteration: It is a poor workman who blames his tools
Translated: यह एक गरीब कार्यकर्ता है जो अपने उपकरणों को दोषी ठहराता है

Idiom: It is always darkest before the dawn
Meaning: Things are going to get better
Transliteration: It is always darkest before the dawn
Translated: सूर्योदय से पहले हमेशा अंधेरा होता है

Meaning: One person alone isn't responsible. Both people are involved.
Translated: टैंगो के लिए दो की जरूरत है

Meaning: Follow a trend, do what everyone else is doing

Idiom: Know which way the wind is blowing
Transliteration: Know which way the wind is blowing
Translated: आइए जानते हैं कि हवा किस तरह बह रही है।

Meaning: Something you never forget how to do

Idiom: Like two peas in a pod
Transliteration: Like two peas in a pod
Translated: एक पॉड में दो पेस की तरह

Idiom: Make hay while the sun shines
Meaning: Take advantage of a good situation
Transliteration: Make hay while the sun shines

Meaning: You're more cautious when you've been hurt before
Translated: एक बार चुंबन, दो बार शिकायत

Idiom: Out of the frying pan and into the fire
Meaning: Things are going from bad to worse
Transliteration: Out of the frying pan and into the fire
Translated: अग्नि से बाहर और आग में
इस जहाज को तोड़ दिया गया है

Idiom: The pot calling the kettle black
Meaning: Someone criticizing someone else he is just as bad
Transliteration: The pot calling the kettle black
Translated: कटोरे का नाम है काले कटोरे

Idiom: There are clouds on the horizon
Transliteration: There are clouds on the horizon

Idiom: Those who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones
Meaning: People who are morally questionable shouldn't criticize others
Transliteration: Those who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones
Translated: जो लोग ग्लास के घरों में रहते हैं उन्हें पत्थर नहीं फेंकना चाहिए

Meaning: In good times and in bad times
Translated: मोटी और पतली के माध्यम से

Meaning: Don't waste things and you'll always have enough
Translated: नहीं चाहता, नहीं चाहता, नहीं चाहता
हम आँख से आँख देखते हैं

Meaning: Getting a good start is important
Everything is going wrong at once
Translated: जब बारिश हो जाती है तो

Idiom: You can catch more flies with honey than you can with vinegar
Meaning: You'll get what you want by being nice
Transliteration: You can catch more flies with honey than you can with vinegar
Translated: आप शहद के साथ आप कर सकते हैं की तुलना में अधिक फ्लेश पकड़ सकते हैं

Idiom: You can lead a horse to water, but you can't make him drink
Meaning: You can't force someone to make the right decision
Transliteration: You can lead a horse to water, but you can't make him drink
Translated: आप एक घोड़े को पानी में ले जा सकते हैं, लेकिन आप उसे पीने के लिए नहीं कर सकते हैं

Idiom: You can't make an omelet without breaking some eggs
Meaning: There's always a cost to doing something
Transliteration: You can't make an omelet without breaking some eggs
Translated: आप कुछ अंडे तोड़ने के बिना एक ओमेलेट नहीं बना सकते हैं
